metadata.title: CVE-2015-8868 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ExponentialFunction::ExponentialFunctionfunction in Poppler before 0.40.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (memory corruption and crash) or possibly execute arbitrary codevia an invalid blend mode in the ExtGState dictionary in a crafted PDFdocument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.4').
